description: NullPointerException in update when addressRepository.findById returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), leading to application crash during address updates.
NullPointerException in delete when addressRepository.findById returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), causing crash during address deletion operations.
Mapper incorrectly maps 'someValue' to 'street' (Functional suitability: correctness), resulting in lost or corrupted street address data during entity-DTO conversion.
Update mapper incorrectly maps 'someValue' to 'street' (Functional suitability: correctness), leading to data corruption in partial address updates.
Hardcoded dummy hash exposes timing attack surface despite comment (Security: resistance), potentially enabling username enumeration via response time differences.
Inconsistent password encoder usage violates DRY principle (Maintainability: modularity), risking future inconsistencies if encoder configuration changes.
Non-descriptive method name 'do_Some_Stuff' violates Clean Code naming principles (Maintainability: analysability), reducing code readability and comprehension.
Constructor uses @Autowired annotation unnecessarily (Maintainability: modularity), as Spring Boot auto-wires by type; this adds redundant noise to the code.
